meanings.definition: A person who lacks good sense or judgment.
meanings.sent1: Some people believe that only fools ignore good advice.
meanings.sent2: The wise man warned his son to stay away from fools.
meanings.sent3: The group of fools thought it was a good idea to swim in a frozen lake.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a fool when she realized she had been tricked by the con artist.
meanings.sent5: The village remembered him as the biggest fool who ever lived.

meanings.sent1: He fools his little sister by hiding her toys.
meanings.sent2: The magician fools the audience with his clever illusions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy tried to fool his friends by wearing a fake mustache.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could fool anyone into thinking she was happy.
meanings.sent5: The clever disguise fooled even the keenest detective.

meanings.sent1: She fools around instead of studying for her exams.
meanings.sent2: The reckless driver fools with danger by speeding on icy roads.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to fool by playing near the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs, he fools into a risky investment.
meanings.sent5: His decision to quit his job and travel the world seemed like a fool's dream.
